channels.name: major_broadcast_news
channels.description: Major TV and online news networks (CNN, Fox, NBC, NYT, AP, etc.) breaking news coverage of the ASI demonstration — the single largest story in human history would dominate every major outlet simultane...[truncated]

channels.name: social_media_viral
channels.description: Viral spread across Twitter/X, YouTube, TikTok, Facebook, Instagram — clips of the live demo, reaction videos, threads dissecting the announcements, memes, and hot takes spreading at unprecedented spe...[truncated]

channels.name: tech_professional_networks
channels.description: Targeted dissemination through professional and technical networks — LinkedIn, Hacker News, industry Slack groups, academic email lists, and direct colleague networks in STEM, finance, law, and medici...[truncated]

channels.name: word_of_mouth_community
channels.description: Informal person-to-person spread through friend and family networks — conversations at work, at home, at church, in community spaces — reaching those with lower digital/media engagement

channels.name: alternative_skeptic_media
channels.description: Coverage by right-leaning media, alternative outlets, podcasts, and conspiracy-adjacent channels that frame the event with doubt, hype, or ideological spin — reaching low-trust, media-skeptical audien...[truncated]

rules.when: primary_news_source in ('TV', 'Online/Digital') and internet_access in ('Broadband', 'Mobile Only')
occupation in ('Professional', 'Management') and education_level in ('Bachelor\'s', 'Graduate Degree') and social_media_platforms in ('Twitter/X', 'YouTube', 'None/Minimal')
trust_in_institutions < 0.35 and news_outlet_lean == 'Right-leaning' and primary_news_source in ('Online/Digital', 'Social Media', 'Radio')
trust_in_institutions < 0.45 and susceptibility_to_misinformation > 0.55 and political_affiliation in ('Strong Republican', 'Lean Republican')
